skill.name: pyhealth
skill.description: Comprehensive healthcare AI toolkit for developing, testing, and deploying machine learning models with clinical data. This skill should be used when working with electronic health records (EHR), clinical prediction tasks (mortality, readmission, drug recommendation), medical coding systems (ICD, NDC, ATC), physiological signals (EEG, ECG), healthcare datasets (MIMIC-III/IV, eICU, OMOP), or implementing deep learning models for healthcare applications (RETAIN, SafeDrug, Transformer, GNN).
skill.summary: Comprehensive healthcare AI toolkit for developing, testing, and deploying machine learning models w...
skill.author: K-Dense-AI

security_audit.summary: This is a documentation-only skill providing guidance for the PyHealth healthcare AI library. All static findings are false positives - the 'external commands' are Python code examples in markdown, and 'weak cryptographic' patterns are medical coding system references (ICD-9/10). No actual code execution or security risks identified.

content.user_title: Build Healthcare AI Models with Clinical Data
content.value_statement: PyHealth simplifies healthcare AI development with pre-built models and datasets for clinical prediction. Use 33+ specialized models for mortality prediction, drug recommendation, and medical coding tasks.
actual_capabilities: Evaluate with clinical metrics and fairness
limitations: Requires large datasets for deep learning

use_cases.title: ICU Mortality Prediction
use_cases.description: Predict patient mortality using MIMIC-IV data with interpretable RETAIN model for clinical insights

use_cases.title: Safe Medication Recommendation
use_cases.description: Recommend medications using SafeDrug model with drug-drug interaction (DDI) constraints to ensure patient safety during treatment planning

use_cases.title: Medical Code Translation
use_cases.description: Convert between ICD-9 and ICD-10 codes for standardized diagnosis reporting

prompt_templates.title: Load Healthcare Dataset
prompt_templates.prompt: Load MIMIC-IV dataset and show basic statistics including patient count, visit distribution, and available features

prompt_templates.title: Define Prediction Task
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a mortality prediction task for ICU patients using diagnoses, procedures, and medications as features

prompt_templates.title: Train Clinical Model
prompt_templates.prompt: Train a RETAIN model for mortality prediction with 128-dimensional embeddings and attention visualization

prompt_templates.title: Evaluate Fairness
prompt_templates.prompt: Evaluate model performance across gender and ethnicity groups to identify potential bias

output_examples.input: Load MIMIC-IV dataset and prepare for readmission prediction
output: Features available: diagnoses, procedures, medications, labs
Data split: 70% train, 10% val, 20% test by patient

best_practices: Always split data by patient to prevent data leakage
Start with baseline models before deep learning
Calibrate predictions and assess fairness before deployment
anti_patterns: Splitting randomly instead of by patient
Using accuracy for imbalanced clinical outcomes
Deploying without clinical validation and interpretation

faq.question: What datasets are supported?
faq.answer: MIMIC-III/IV, eICU, OMOP, SleepEDF, SHHS, and custom EHR formats

faq.question: Do I need a GPU?
faq.answer: GPU recommended for deep learning models but baselines work on CPU

faq.question: How do I handle missing data?
faq.answer: Use PyHealth preprocessors for imputation and handling missing clinical values

faq.question: Can this be used for clinical deployment?
faq.answer: Models need external validation, calibration, and clinical review before deployment

faq.question: What medical codes are supported?
faq.answer: ICD-9/10, NDC, RxNorm, ATC, CCS, LOINC, and custom vocabularies

faq.question: How do I interpret model predictions?
faq.answer: Use attention weights, SHAP values, or ChEFER for clinical interpretability
